date_timeutilities

Class Date_TimeUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • date_timeutilities.Date_TimeUtilities

  • public class Date_TimeUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    A utility class designed to provide an aggregation of commonly used actions when interacting with the LocalDate & LocalDateTime classes found in the new API for Java (after JDK 8).

    Change History:

    • 04/18/2017- Initial Version

    Since:
    1.8

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Date_TimeUtilities() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String dateTimeToString_AmericanFormat(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
      Converts a date/time object into a String that is formatted in the Americanized style of mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss
      java.lang.String dateTimeToString_AmericanLongFormat(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
      Formats a LocalDateTime object in a long format, spelling the entire month and including the time of the object on a 12 hour clock.
      java.lang.String dateToString_AmericanFormat(java.time.LocalDate date)
      Formats a LocalDate and outputs a string.
      long getChronoUnitsBetweenTwoDates(java.time.LocalDateTime start, java.time.LocalDateTime end, java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit units)
      Accepts a start and end time in addition to a ChronoUnit.
      java.time.LocalDate stringToLocalDate(java.lang.String date, java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatter)
      Converts a formatted string into a Date/Time object.
      java.time.LocalDateTime stringToLocalDateTime(java.lang.String date, java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatter)
      Accepts a String and a DateTimeFormatter and returns LocalDateTime object.

        public java.lang.String dateTimeToString_AmericanFormat(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a date/time object into a String that is formatted in the Americanized style of mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss
        Parameters:
        dateTime - -a LocalDateTime object
        Returns:
        stringDateAndTime- properly formatted String
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dateTime is null.

      • dateTimeToString_AmericanLongFormat

        public java.lang.String dateTimeToString_AmericanLongFormat(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime)
                                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Formats a LocalDateTime object in a long format, spelling the entire month and including the time of the object on a 12 hour clock.
        Parameters:
        dateTime- - a LocalDateTime object
        Returns:
        stringDateAndTime- a formatted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dateTime is null.

      • dateToString_AmericanFormat

        public java.lang.String dateToString_AmericanFormat(java.time.LocalDate date)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Formats a LocalDate and outputs a string. Utilizes the American "month first" format.
        Parameters:
        date- - a LocalDate object
        Returns:
        stringDate- a formatted string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if date is null.

      • stringToLocalDate

        public java.time.LocalDate stringToLocalDate(java.lang.String date,
                                             java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatter)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.time.format.DateTimeParseException
        Converts a formatted string into a Date/Time object. The format of the String can be chosen by the user by passing in a DateTimeFormatter.
        Parameters:
        date- - A String
        formatter- - A DateTimeFormatter object
        Returns:
        localDate- a LocalDate object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if date or formatter is null.
        java.time.format.DateTimeParseException - if the string `date` is not parseable using a formatter object.

      • stringToLocalDateTime

        public java.time.LocalDateTime stringToLocalDateTime(java.lang.String date,
                                                     java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter formatter)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Accepts a String and a DateTimeFormatter and returns LocalDateTime object.
        Parameters:
        date- - A String
        formatter- - A DateTimeFormatter object
        Returns:
        localDateTime- a LocalDateTime object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if date or formatter is null.

      • getChronoUnitsBetweenTwoDates

        public long getChronoUnitsBetweenTwoDates(java.time.LocalDateTime start,
                                          java.time.LocalDateTime end,
                                          java.time.temporal.ChronoUnit units)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Accepts a start and end time in addition to a ChronoUnit. Returns a long value that is the difference between the start date/time and end date/time.
        Parameters:
        start- - a LocalDateTime object
        end- - a LocalDateTime object
        units- - a valid ChronoUnit enum value. ChronoUnit is an implementation of the TemporalUnit interface found in package java.time.temporal. Used to determine what unit of measurement is used when performing the calculation
        Returns:
        timeBetween- a long
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when any arguments to the method are null.
